datasetStructure: One record per sample characteristic or time-point concentration per reference time point or per analyte per subject

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: PCGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: Specimen ID.
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: PCREFID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: PCSPID

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the analyte or specimen characteristic. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). PCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: ASA, VOL, SPG.
datasetVariables.label: Pharmacokinetic Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: PCTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCTEST

datasetVariables.description: Name of the analyte or specimen characteristic. Note any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in PCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Acetylsalicylic Acid, Volume, Specific Gravity.
datasetVariables.label: Pharmacokinetic Test Name
datasetVariables.name: PCTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: ANALYTE, SPECIMEN PROPERTY.
datasetVariables.label: Test Category
datasetVariables.name: PCCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of a test category.
datasetVariables.label: Test Subcategory
datasetVariables.name: PCSCAT

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: PCORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PCORRES. Example: mg/L.
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: PCORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from PCORRES in a standard format or standard units. PCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in PCSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in PCORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in PCSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: PCSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from PCSTRESC. PCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: PCSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for PCSTRESC and PCSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: PCSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a result was not obtained. Should be null if a result exists in PCORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: PCSTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why a result was not obtained such as SPECIMEN LOST. Used in conjunction with PCSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Test Not Done
datasetVariables.name: PCREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCNAM

datasetVariables.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provides the test results.
datasetVariables.label: Vendor Name
datasetVariables.name: PCNAM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSPEC

datasetVariables.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Material Type
datasetVariables.name: PCSPEC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCSPCCND

datasetVariables.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen e.g. HEMOLYZED, ICTERIC, LIPEMIC etc.
datasetVariables.label: Specimen Condition
datasetVariables.name: PCSPCCND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples include HPLC/MS, ELISA. This should contain sufficient information and granularity to allow differentiation of various methods that might have been used within a study.
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test or Examination
datasetVariables.name: PCMETHOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCFAST

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status.
datasetVariables.label: Fasting Status
datasetVariables.name: PCFAST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null. Records that represent the average of other records, which do not come from the CRF, are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If PCDRVFL=Y, then PCORRES may be null with PCSTRESC, and (if numeric) PCSTRESN having the derived value.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: PCDRVFL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCLLOQ

datasetVariables.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units should be those used in PCSTRESU.
datasetVariables.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
datasetVariables.name: PCLLOQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. If there is no end time, then this will be the collection time.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: PCDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCENDTC

datasetVariables.description: End date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. If there is no end time, the collection time should be stored in PCDTC, and PCENDTC should be null.
datasetVariables.label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: PCENDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCDY

self.title: Actual Study Day of Specimen Collection

datasetVariables.description: 1. Study day of specimen collection, measured as integer days. 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Actual Study Day of Specimen Collection
datasetVariables.name: PCDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCTPT

datasetVariables.description: 1. Text Description of time when specimen should be taken. 2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PCTPTNUM and PCTPTREF. Examples: Start, 5 min post.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: PCTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of PCTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: PCTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (PCTPTREF) such as "PREVIOUS DOSE" or "PREVIOUS MEAL". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: PCELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point used as a basis for PCTPT, PCTPTNUM, and PCELTM. Example: Most Recent Dose.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: PCTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of the reference time point described by PCTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Point
datasetVariables.name: PCRFTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.1.2 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable PC.PCEVLINT

datasetVariables.description: Evaluation Interval associated with a PCTEST record represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-P2H" to represent an interval of 2 hours prior to a PCTPT.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluation Interval
datasetVariables.name: PCEVLINT

description: A findings domain that contains concentrations of drugs or metabolites in fluids or tissues as a function of time. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49606, 2018-06-29)
label: Pharmacokinetic Concentrations
name: PC
